response.answer_text: Hi i am Preshit Agarwal . Arihant publication books i would not reccomend to u . I would only ask u to go through physics book of arihant publication whose writer is dc pandey . Its a fantastic book and it clear the concepts within minutes . It first makes us understands about the type of questions that can be made and the ques are in increasing difficulty level to make us prepare from good to even worse ques that can come in a medical examination. Now u would be thinking that is me (Preshit) a fool , first he said that its not good now he is saying that its best for physics. There is a reason behind there as i have gone through the arihant publications book and i found that it wasnt appropriate for biology and chemistry as most of the ques have wrong answer and the methodbof solving is also not correct which will not be helpful for your neet exam . So i would reccomend you to buy physics by dc pandey , chemistry and biology by mtg (ncert at your fingertips) So thats it and i hope u crack neet with very good rank . See u later……..☺

Arihant books are of higher level as far as NEET is concerned. They are good for IIT JEE! Chemistry: NCERT most important. Other than that, for reference, use OP Tandon, Himanshu Pandey, Pradeeps, Morrison and Boyd etc BIO: Start with NCERT, . Then go ahead with previous year questions. You can also refer to Trueman’s. Physics: Start with SL Arora HC Verma. Practice from NEET Champion, NCERT at your fingertips !.. Then go ahead with previous year Questions directly. Dont go for any other crap books. Practice previous year questions MANY TIMES.Become perfect in them.Solve other people’s doubts. These will help you score better :). People run after so many modules and crap test series. Instead you should focus on limited material and do it more number of times !! Many questions ask only basic concepts but a good clarity in them. Best Wishes Satnara IIT AIIMS Academy (an initiative by IITians.. )

Then for mcq firstly refer aakash modules(any tutorial), target publication and mtg they completely sticks to ncert I liked them and disha publication also has lot of mcq u can download free chapter of disha from Kindle. 1.Biology for theory ncert is sufficent and if want extra go though tutorials book or not any then theory by pradeep or dinesh. Still Ncert is sufficent. Cencage also have good stuff of MCQs. 1.Ncert for bio 2 . target mtg disha arihant master guide for bio 3. Chem o p tondon mcq mtg target disha they are cheap too 4. Physics is tough part go till September. Atleast only though ncert by heart all ur concepts and u can switch to HC Verma for mcq again the same arihant master guide is probably good it has high level questions…… Hope this helps

The NEET Syllabus 2020 includes topics covered in Class 11 and 12 Physics, Biology, and Chemistry syllabus. The weightage is different for every section. Owing to the vast syllabus and fierce competitive levels, NEET is deemed as one of the toughest competitive exams. Before you start your NEET preparations, students are recommended to know and understand each topic the syllabus has to offer. You can use Arihant’s Practice sets as they are some great questions that would help you to practice. The book Chemistry for Medical Sciences by Preeti Gupta (Arihant) is also very good for this purpose. If you wish to get your hands on these books for free, you can check out MyPustak. They deliver the books to you and just take shipping charges in return. Happy Reading!
